meanings.definition: Having a surface that is smooth and difficult to grip.
meanings.sent1: The ice was the slipperiest I had ever seen, making it hard to walk on.
meanings.sent2: The wet floor in the bathroom was the slipperiest surface in the house.
meanings.sent3: Trying to dance on the slipperiest ice, I ended up sliding around like a penguin.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like the slipperiest slope, causing misunderstandings to quickly escalate.
meanings.sent5: The slipperiest banana peel on the sidewalk caused many to slip and fall.

meanings.definition: Being the most difficult to hold onto or maintain control of.
meanings.sent1: The slipperiest situation I faced was trying to juggle too many tasks at once.
meanings.sent2: The slipperiest part of the job was managing conflicting priorities.
meanings.sent3: Balancing on one foot while juggling oranges was the slipperiest challenge of all.
meanings.sent4: Her temper was like the slipperiest rope, impossible to grasp and hold onto.
meanings.sent5: Navigating through the maze of emotions was like walking on the slipperiest ground.
